@soumith perf numbers with cuda synchronization added:

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(10)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=10000)
4.490745688905008

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(1000)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=1000)
0.43900702497921884

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(100000)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=1000)
0.912136640981771

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(10000000)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=10)
0.0020317300222814083

They are roughly the same as the previous numbers and I suspect it's because Thrust does cuda synchronization internally.

@soumith perf numbers with cuda synchronization added:

```
>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(10)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=10000)
4.490745688905008

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(1000)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=1000)
0.43900702497921884

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(100000)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=1000)
0.912136640981771

>>> timeit.timeit('torch.randperm(10000000)', setup='import torch; torch.set_default_tensor_type("torch.cuda.FloatTensor"); torch.manual_seed(1);torch.randperm(10); torch.cuda.synchronize()', number=10)
0.0020317300222814083
```

They are roughly the same as the previous numbers and I suspect it's because Thrust does cuda synchronization internally.
